instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1990: What is A1990? A1990 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2018, 2019 with EMC3215, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01041, 820-01814..
definitions.PP3V3_S0SW_LCD: What is PP3V3_S0SW_LCD? PP3V3_S0SW_LCD is a 3.3v power rail necessary to power the image circuitry on the screen. This is necessary to get a picture on the screen. .
definitions.I2C_BKLT_SDA: What is I2C_BKLT_SDA? I2C_BKLT_SDA is a data line between the LCD screen and the LED driver. This data line cannot short to ground. If it does, the screen cannot talk to the LED driver, and the LED driver will not allow the circuit to produce a backlight..
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..
definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no display, small water damage on screen connector.
threads.message:
water damage at the screen connector but at screen side, there is no water damage at the board , no backlight and no display. try also with good screen.
j8500:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F</SIGNAL> - 5.1V
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKL</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL> - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>I2C_BKLT_SDA</SIGNAL>/SCL - 5.1V
<SIGNAL>I2C_TCON_SDA</SIGNAL>/SCL - 3.4V
<SIGNAL>I2C_ALS</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>I2C_CAM</SIGNAL> - 1.8V
<SIGNAL>MIPI_FTCAM_CLK</SIGNAL> - 0.4V

ALL THE REST 0V
any idea?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no display, small water damage on screen connector.
threads.message:
"screen connector but at screen side"
It is connected to MLB directly.

Did you try another LCD assembly?
Check diode mode on data lines.

I cannot say more , as you didn't post MLB code yet...

there was water damage at the screen side(screen board), but the water didn't touch the main board.
i was try another LCD but the same...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no display, small water damage on screen connector.
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no display, small water damage on screen connector.
threads.message:
Mentioned connector replicates J8500 from the MLB.
The water spill affected MLB, of coruse.

Check diode mode to ground at <SIGNAL>EDP_INT</SIGNAL> lines.
Pay atention to <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL>.
If you have luck, maybe <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> bad only.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1990</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no display, small water damage on screen connector.
threads.message:

If yes, then is time to change <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.
